page.title: 12EDUCATION
page.content: There was once a{village school}in Rhydycroesau but it was no longer in use, the building being used as a village hall. Likewise there was a village school in Pant_Glas. This too has closed and is now divided into three houses. A retired teacher is one of the people who live there. The Pant Glas school opened in 1861 and closed in 1945. Most of the children of{primary school}age went in Selattyn, though some nearer to Oswestry go to schools in the town. The nearest{secondary schools}are in Oswestry, catering for children aged between 11 and 16. Oswestry serves as the centre for those seeking tertiary education. The town also has a modern{library}which is well patronised by local youngsters engaged in research.
